trans-unit.source: Provides data for the **AnonymousIdentification_Creating** event.
This class cannot be inherited.

The <xref:System.Web.Security.AnonymousIdentificationEventArgs> class is used to supply event values to the <xref:System.Web.Security.AnonymousIdentificationModule.Creating> event and to enable you to specify a custom Windows identity for the current request.

You can access the <xref:System.Web.Security.AnonymousIdentificationModule.Creating> event of the <xref:System.Web.Security.AnonymousIdentificationModule> class by specifying a subroutine named **AnonymousIdentification_Creating** in the Global.asax file for your ASP.NET application.

The <xref:System.Web.Security.AnonymousIdentificationModule> constructs a <xref:System.Web.Security.AnonymousIdentificationEventArgs> object using the current <xref:System.Web.HttpContext> and passes it to the **AnonymousIdentification_Creating** event.

You can use the <xref:System.Web.Security.AnonymousIdentificationEventArgs.AnonymousID%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.Security.AnonymousIdentificationEventArgs> object supplied to the **AnonymousIdentification_Creating** event to set the anonymous identifier to a custom value.

If you do not specify a value for the <xref:System.Web.Security.AnonymousIdentificationEventArgs.AnonymousID%2A> property during the **AnonymousIdentification_Creating** event, a <xref:System.Guid> is used.
The **AnonymousIdentification_Creating** event is only raised when the anonymous identification is <xref:System.Web.Security.AnonymousIdentificationModule.Enabled%2A>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Security.AnonymousIdentificationEventArgs"></xref> class.
The <xref:System.Web.Security.AnonymousIdentificationModule> constructs a <xref:System.Web.Security.AnonymousIdentificationEventArgs> object using the current <xref:System.Web.HttpContext>.
It then passes the <xref:System.Web.Security.AnonymousIdentificationEventArgs> object to the **AnonymousIdentification_Creating** event.
The context for the event.
Gets or sets the anonymous identifier for the user.

You can use the <xref:System.Web.Security.AnonymousIdentificationEventArgs.AnonymousID%2A> property to set the anonymous identifier to a custom value during the **AnonymousIdentification_Creating** event.

If you do not specify a value for the <xref:System.Web.Security.AnonymousIdentificationEventArgs.AnonymousID%2A> property during the **AnonymousIdentification_Creating** event, a <xref:System.Guid> is used.
The **AnonymousIdentification_Creating** event is only raised when the anonymous identification is <xref:System.Web.Security.AnonymousIdentificationModule.Enabled%2A>.
The anonymous identifier for the user.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.HttpContext"></xref> object for the current HTTP request.

The <xref:System.Web.HttpContext> provides access to <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.Request%2A>, <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.Response%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.User%2A> objects for the current request.
The <xref href="System.Web.HttpContext"></xref> object for the current HTTP request.
